meanings.definition: Stand or wait around without apparent purpose.
meanings.sent1: The kids were loitering outside the store after school.
meanings.sent2: She was caught loitering in the hallway during class.
meanings.sent3: The cat was loitering by the window, hoping for a bird to appear.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to be loitering, dragging its feet as the meeting went on.
meanings.sent5: The clouds loitering in the sky made the sunset even more beautiful.

meanings.sent1: The old man was loitering along the path, enjoying the fresh air.
meanings.sent2: The river loitered through the valley, meandering gently.
meanings.sent3: The snail loitered across the garden, taking its time to explore.
meanings.sent4: The music loitered in the air, lingering long after the concert ended.
meanings.sent5: The fog loitered over the city, creating a mysterious atmosphere.
